messages.message:
no, we do not have any error codes within the response body for `/v2/apps/runs/<RUN-ID>/results`

if there's an error, you'll have to refer to the HTTP status code - from the code (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/blob/e53afb2/webserver/api-server/src/py/instabase/api_server_apps/handler/api/v2/apps.py#L832), it seems the possible status codes are the following
• `BAD_REQUEST` / 400
• `INTERNAL_SERVER_ERROR` / 500
for both error cases, the response body will be `{"message": "error message"}`
